page.title: 05Fox's Biscuits
page.content: Fox's biscuits began in 1853 in a small shop in Batley,by a man called Mr. Alfred Henry Fox.In 1853 the main biscuits were ginger biscuits and brandy snaps. Such good progress was made with this type of trade that in 1927 they moved to the present site just some few hundred yards away from the origional bakery.From that date it has been extended to over 37,000 sqft. When Mr.Fox made biscuits he made them by hand,but in today's technology they have huge machines to make them.Here are some examples of what Fox's biscuits make:-custard creams ,jammy dodgers,finger creams and butter crinkles. The machines make the biscuits but the people pack them,and fox's employ over 2,000 people.Fox's biscuits is the bibbest employer in Batley.
